metadata.title: CVE-2022-2526 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in systemd. This issue occurs dueto the on_stream_io() function and dns_stream_complete() function in'resolved-dns-stream.c' not incrementing the reference counting for theDnsStream object. Therefore, other functions and callbacks called candereference the DNSStream object, causing the use-after-free when thereference is still used later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libnss-mymachines - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libnss-resolve - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libnss-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libpam-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libsystemd0 - 237-3ubuntu10.56
libudev1 - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd-container - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd-coredump - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd-journal-remote - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd-sysv - 237-3ubuntu10.56
systemd-tests - 237-3ubuntu10.56
udev - 237-3ubuntu10.56
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '237-3ubuntu10.56').
